creator: @next

content:
Margaret, if you click on Windows File Explorer, look at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles. If this folder exists, then click any folder inside it and look for a file called abook.sqlite. That would be the addressbook. If File Explorer does not let you view the folders, you can click View>Show>Hidden items in File Explorer. The folders will be there if all you did was uninstall Thunderbird, but there is a final prompt on an uninstall on whether to keep data, so it's possible you may have deleted it.

If you have done a new install, there may be more than one folder in the Profiles folder, so look for the oldest and largest abook.sqlite. Let me know if you need more assistance.
creator: davidsk

content: I am puzzled, as I see no prior question from you on your issue. If you ever decide again to leave Apple, please post your questions with some detail on whatever the issue is. You obviously had a problem, but it's not in your posts. Good luck.
creator: davidsk

content:
Perhaps the subject line wasn't enough of a lead-in to the first paragraph. So, from the top:

1) I had 3 Apple-mail email accounts which were misbehaving 2) I saw that Thunderbird, which I used to use a long time ago, had come back to life. So I switched two of my email accounts over to Thunderbird Result: Whoops, I could only send mail on a single Thunderbird email account. The second email account simply wouldn't send

3) I looked on Thunderbird's support pages and realized I was not alone and that the "answer" seemed to be to delete the existing Thunderbird email accounts and start from scratch. (Which I refuse to do.) Result: For the moment I'm returning to Apple mail as the problem I had been having has gone away

Observation: The "automatic" setup for Thunderbird works like a charm, so long as you want ONE email account. If you want more than a single email account, then a set-up recipe or other documentation would be lovely as it would prevent users from screwing up their settings
creator: seh1593

content: Thunderbird only restores whatever password your had previously provided. If thunderbird is presenting message of incorrect password, you need to contact email provider for password.
